issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: task
components.description: The code that runs in the child task process.

fields.description:
I've recently using hadoop(version 0.21.0) for some data processing, but sometimes reducer crashed. Always the log is like bellow, which tells when multi fetchers recieved mapoutput simultaneously, the merge part may fail due to some disadvantages. To verify this assumption, I then set the number of fetchers to 1 (mapreduce.reduce.shuffle.parallelcopies), after which the problem dispeared and the job works well.

comments.body:
-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12487597/patch.txt
  against trunk revision 1149323.

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    -1 tests included.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    -1 patch.  The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/496//console

This message is automatically generated.
I am not sure if 0.21 is really supported any more.  In either case you will need to post test results for your patch.
